website_summaries.verdict: A well-balanced mattock that has a comfortable grip.  It is solid and well made.  Feels very durable in your hands.
pros: Loose heads have plagued mattocks from time immemorial, but this one is riveted in place so it won’t slide down the handle of fly off when you’re swinging it
The internal shock absorbing system protects  our hands from painful vibrations
cons: The blade isn’t sharp at all when it arrives
It can be sharpened with a whetstone but you shouldn’t have to

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pick axe!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried several other tools to break through the hard, compacted earth in my new home's back yard and none of them could make more than a dent in the earth. While I've just discovered exactly how out of shape I am, this pick axe sunk deep into the earth with my first swing, almost effortlessly! Even when it wound up stuck under, or even IN large roots, I was able to pry them out of the earth as well without the slightest hint of complaint from the pick axe itself. And the flat blade was actually able to chop completely through the roots which would normally take me several swings with a hatchet! I'm genuinely impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Buehler

customer_reviews.title: Plants trees like nobodies business
customer_reviews.text: I got a Fiskar's sledge hammer for demo work, and it worked so well that I tried out this Pick/Hammock. I had been digging holes like a neanderthal with hand-me-down wooden handle shovels. It was brutal work, I ended it sweaty, exhausted, and with tons of callouses. This pickaxe, I planted an adult tree in a half hour. 1 callous. 1 big grin on my face. It's awesome! Feels sturdy, doesn't transfer shock, and digs like no ones business. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cybernetic.Eve

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it is made to last.  Having a blast with it.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't find my old pock axe ( the wooden handle slipped up and down on it sometimes anyway, so I bought my first very own pick axe at age 71! First project is to dig down 4 inches in my hard clay soil pour sand, then lay pavers down the side of my house. DO NOT try digging a drainage ditch in the pouring rain next to, and away from the house where the pavers are going to be set. I ended up a muddy, wet mess and had to keep digging deeper and deeper as I went from front to back of house.. the mud just slid back into my trench. I better go take pick axe digging lessons.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE GARDEN TOOL EVER
customer_reviews.text: Best gardening tool I've ever bought! My yard has been taken over by a grass that grows in huge, well-rooted clumps that can reach heights of six or seven feet during rainy summer months. I gave myself sciatica last year, trying to dig them out using a sharpened spade (during their winter dormant season), which was slow, exhausting, and largely futile. This year, however, my new Fiskars mattock actually made the chore EASY! Yes, it was work, but not exhausting, and with no sciatica. I am so glad that I invested in this high-quality tool. It truly empowers me!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Reed

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool, comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to dig up 3 tree stumps from ~20ft trees and it had no problem getting through dirt and medium-sized roots.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool
customer_reviews.text: What a great tool! I am a 60-year-old woman, and I can handle this mattock with ease. It makes short work of tilling my raised beds.
customer_reviews.author: grifkalou

customer_reviews.title: Beastly!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a monster. Only wish I bought it a couple seasons ago. I have dense, rocky, clay and sandy soil in NJ and this thing tears right through it. It's heavy duty and chops through roots too. I use it to break up soil. It is a tad on the heavy side, but I'm very out of shape. I give a few whacks to the soil and can now shovel with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Rick James

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I put this thing to use immediately when I got it. I had broken an older one I had and needed a good, sturdy replacement. I was digging up a plot of black bamboo, and it has been a struggle. Fortunately, this tool is more than capable of digging through the mass of roots and dense, hard clay. I look forward to many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Good weight for lawn work
customer_reviews.text: Used this tool to tear up the lawn/bushes to seed grass. The heft made it very easy to removes roots or cut right through them. Nothing I disliked- no blisters or anything from a few hours of constant use.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse B.

customer_reviews.title: Company Makes Great Products
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several different Fiskar tools and I have to say it's high quality and design, balanced. The maul is heavy and I really don't have to do as much work as others I have had in the past. It is designed for heavy duty...you know this by just picking it up.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Savarese

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I am biased because I like fiskars, they make a good quality item and it lasts! Good length for a 5'9 person to dig a trench.
customer_reviews.author: jason.ardans

customer_reviews.title: Feels like it will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: Well built like all other fiskars products. Bought this to replace a broken pickaxe i got from Home Depot last year and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I finally managed to bend mine a little, but I was abusing it prying in a stump. It is still very serviceable though, and I'll bend it back one of these days. heavy to swing, but that helps it hit hard.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Best pick you can buy
customer_reviews.text: This worked great! Broke out of prison with it. Made cement walls into chunks. Will buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Tiny Girl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pick mattock
customer_reviews.text: Well made, riveted head should not loosen up ever, great tool to have for garden-no matter how small, and other uses breaking up ground and roots.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Another great Fiskars tool
customer_reviews.text: A well-built pick that easily cuts through and removes small to medium tree roots. I think the IsoCore feature really does reduce vibrations and fatigue. I used it to dig out tree stumps, and I wouldn't think of doing another stump without this tool. It is great for what it is, but if you are hoping to chop through large roots I would recommend also getting an axe.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Troyer

customer_reviews.title: 5 lb. pickaxe
customer_reviews.text: Had old stump green in center beat off the dead limbs not lightweight.The handle didn’t vibrate like other pickaxes.Be careful will bounce off green wood the ground and small rocks don’t stand a chance. I like it. ✌🏽
customer_reviews.author: Madkat

customer_reviews.title: Such a great tool
customer_reviews.text: I love my pick. Wish I had gotten one sooner. I've been mostly using it to dig small trenches and take out bushes. I have found it difficult to use for removing large stumps, but that probably requires a more heavy-duty tool.
customer_reviews.author: M. Oren

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars Quality is Evident..
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made tool. My only disappointment is my own fault. I would have liked a slightly lighter smaller version, as I wanted this for trail building where I don't need quite the heft of this mattock. But that's not the tool's fault, and there's nothing to complain about in the way this thing is built.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: No regrets, this thing is awesome!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I converted from a lighter pick to this one with no regrets! My arms get a little more tired when using this but it has improved my productivity immensely! Another great product from fiskars!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonManiac

customer_reviews.title: 100 feet of electrical conduit in the ground!
customer_reviews.text: This tool was extremely helpful with a home project. I needed to dig a 100 foot trench, 18 inches down, for some electrical conduit. I couldnt have done it without this pick. Thankful I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: YJB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I’m very Impressed of how light and comfortable this tool is. I’ve tried many picks before and first few minutes I get blisters with this one I didn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Kilo

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, durable, shock absorbing works great
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, durable, shock absorbing works great. Been building stairs down a mountain and this tool has been a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Tangalin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Very heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the composite handle, this is not light. The head is seriously sturdy and heavy. It is super efficient as long as you can swing it.
customer_reviews.author: roverskunk

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for an older tool. Another fine tool from Fiskars.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: It's the best one.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to remove buried tree branches, grapevines and stumps. Works very well. Sturdy. Light weight but strong. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Durable
customer_reviews.text: This pick is one durable tool. Fiskars always seem to make great tools. It should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Goldpirate

customer_reviews.title: perfect pick axe
customer_reviews.text: It's lighter than you think, but it's not lightweight. But this thing makes digging up dirt easy
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Bomar

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to have.
customer_reviews.text: It's a lot of work but it works great! Breaks up sandstone very well, a must have tool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Pick
customer_reviews.text: This pick is very sturdy. It looks like it will last a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: Josef Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Pick Pick Pick
customer_reviews.text: First time using a pick and this one feels awesome. Easy to swing, easy to handle and not heavy at all.
customer_reviews.author: PlAyEd-YoU

customer_reviews.title: This a great well balanced pick
customer_reviews.text: I used this to break up some clay dirt behind my house, it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, and I got it at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Louis M. White

customer_reviews.title: Strong!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have clay soil in my back yard. I didn't think I was going to break through but the tool is light weight durable and surly gets the job done well.. made digging go by a lot faster
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Used it to hack through caliche in west Texas. It’s tough, sharp, And comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Engineerrock

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It’s definitely not light weight. But a good sturdy product. I love anything that fiskars makes.
customer_reviews.author: CmFordham

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Used for digging small trench in clay soil which has tree roots and shale. Worked very well!
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier

customer_reviews.title: Quality of build and feel is top notch. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality of build and feel is top notch. I own the X27 splitting axe as well. Both products are superb as to any other that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Breaks up compact dirt quickly and fairly easily
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool to break up tons of dirt that was left in an unfinished portion of my basement. It chips it away quickly and fairly easily and even goes through roots. This has saved me a lot of time over trying to do it with a shovel alone (big mistake). And is very well built and shows no signs of wear (other than being dirty) after about 1 month of intense use.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Beast
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Works great. Lightweight for the effectiveness while cultivating
customer_reviews.author: Ian Young

customer_reviews.title: Commercial grade for sure
customer_reviews.text: Commercial grade, i ended up not needing it, still in wrapper, anyone wanna buy it?
customer_reviews.author: rad

customer_reviews.title: This is one nicely built tool
customer_reviews.text: This is one nicely built tool. I hammered through hundreds of square feet of dirt taking out rocks, weeds, roots, etc. Other than being sore when I was done, the tool looked like I had just taken it out of the box. The weight was perfect and the build quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Bill

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction. Job well done.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction on this product. Made quick work of roots and some stumps I needed to remove. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DisKid

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It's quite heavy so you may be surprised first time lifting it. But the weight helps drive it deep. Works well on hard, compacted soil.
customer_reviews.author: Claus Jensen

customer_reviews.title: World's Best Mattock
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mattock in existence. I won't leave this laying in the bed of my truck, though; even if the handle won't rot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian by default

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product that will last
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned many pick axes over the years and this one might top the list. Heavy duty without being overly cumbersome and well balanced. Many years of use
customer_reviews.author: Robb M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Love it
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, great handle and overall grand brand. Fiskars always seems to make things right.
customer_reviews.author: Ronaldo

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my 74 year young Boyfriend. He couldn’t believe an improved pick! Made what he needed to do a lot easier on his aging bones. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Bianco

customer_reviews.title: Stump digger
customer_reviews.text: This has been life saver on digging out stumps, reducing time by at least 50%, as well as leveling out an area of yard in the desert grounds of Phoenix. Great quality product.
customer_reviews.author: baba yaga

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: all right I was a bit tick when it was late but it's a nice tool very comfortable. I dig it
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Used this to remove a tree stump from my backyard. This is so heavy and sharp it ripped out that stump in no time. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: seems sturdy, so far
customer_reviews.text: This is made to bang against the ground filled with stones. It seem sturdy enough so far. We'll see how the edges keep, but I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Trurl

customer_reviews.title: ... always needed one of these and fiskers makes a great
customer_reviews.text: I always needed one of these and fiskers makes a great product
customer_reviews.author: Duane M.

customer_reviews.title: Effective hand tool
customer_reviews.text: Very useful tool. Made hand digging a trench a lot easier. This tool cuts through roots and scoops dirt out quite effectively. Aside from renting a trencher, this tool was very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Allen S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My favorite pick ax. The grip is padded and the blade is sharp. Fiskars is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good took
customer_reviews.text: Good tool. A little too expensive but worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: marcelino morales

customer_reviews.title: Well made, sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Actually sharp! Hard to find tools that are sharp out of the box/off the shelve.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Built like a tank, I haven’t come across many hand tools I couldn’t break. Will come in handy during the zombie apocalypse.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered tool for a tough job
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for digging a deep trench through Indiana clay. Made short (albeit hard) work of what would have been days worth of trench shoveling.
customer_reviews.author: HOLLIEWDWRD

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Is nice and strong. I am using it to break up large roots from an old tree.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: It was so awesome - it was momentarily invisible until my darling wife ...
customer_reviews.text: There I stood, in my kitchen, looking for my treasured Pickaxe. It was so awesome - it was momentarily invisible until my darling wife instructed for me to turn around. Once laying my eyes upon the fabled box of yor -I heard angels sing as I ripped open the box to finally gaze unto it's lustrous shine. Oh what a Pickaxe! As I held it in my hands, I felt a tingle in my chest like non other. My wife gasped in delight as I transformed from a modern day man - to a rugged burly miner! I instantly knew I had purchased the Pickaxe of all Pickaxes. (Review by the Husband of account holder)
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: A very pleasant tool to use. You should own one.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Well designed
customer_reviews.text: Pick is well-designed in terms of shape, size, and weight
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect length, weight and strength for digging out stumps and roots. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pick, with my job I use it nearly everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S

customer_reviews.title: Lousy not shock absorbing pick nor sharp.
customer_reviews.text: There is no shock absorption at all and the blade is not sharp either. It took me so long just to remove 4 one inch root and the bones in my hand are sore because of the impact of the pick hitting the roots over and over. My hands absorbed the shock not the pick. I am a huge fan of Fiskars. I owned about 20 Fiskars tools so I am hugely disappointed with this pick which I bought to replace a wooden pick which is just as bad but did not cost so much.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this pick. It's heavy duty. It's weight makes it easy to ues. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B..

product_meta.title: Fiskars 751210-1001 Shade Fabric with 90% UV Protection (6'x15'), 5 lb, Rainforest
product_meta.description: Size:5 lbThis rugged, powerful pick allows you to break up hard surfaces and dig in hard soil while helping to reduce muscle fatigue and joint pain. Premium steel is forged into a perfectly balanced design to help make every swing your best. Fiskars patented, industry-leading IsoCore Shock Control System absorbs strike shock and vibration, reducing the punishment your body takes, and a dual-layer handle captures any lingering vibration. An inseparable riveted head will not slide down or snap off, even when swinging with maximum force. A performance handle design fits your hand securely and comfortably with strategic texturing that helps improve grip while reducing blisters. This design has been tested to exceed U.S. standards for striking tool durability to withstand the toughest work environments. Length: 36 Inch Weight: 5 lb.
feature_bullets: Ideal for breaking up rocky surfaces such as gravel and hardened, dried earth (pointed end), or for use as a hoe when digging in tough soil (flat end)
Patented IsoCore Shock Control System absorbs strike shock and vibration to reduce the punishment your body takes, transferring 2X less shock and vibration than wood handles
Insulation sleeve captures initial strike shock before it can reach your hand
Dual-layer handle features a specially formulated combination of insulating materials to dampen lingering vibration

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars228 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
